result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joseph John Lagrander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph John Lagrander is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph John Lagrander was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 15, 2016.
Probation may be transferred to Washington County MN.
Court notes 13 days credit if revoked.



In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 3-01-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA.  If DE pays the balances in full by 3-14-16, DE may have the $15 PPF vacated if requested in writing.  Includes 12CM390, 15CF380. jaf
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Joseph John Lagrander appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CF380 & 15CM486.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State files a 12 month Deferred Judgment of Conviction on Ct. 2 in 15CF380.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 15CF380. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication of Guilt upon the full performance of the DPA.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 3 in 15CF380.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 3 in  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & Ct. 4 in  15CF380 and file 15CM486. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:


Ct. 3 in 15CF380
- W/S 1 year probation with conditions
- Probation can be transferred to Wahsington County
- DE is ordered that he have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons, Rebeka S..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- Firearms can be returned at the completion of probation period
- Credit for 13 days if revoked
-  DE to report to probation today 01/15/16
- 20 days to appeal

Ct 2 in 15CF380
- Court reviews the 12 month Deferred Judgment of Conviction with the DE
- Court approves and signs the Order
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-15-2016 11:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF:Joseph John Lagrander appeared.  Court called at 2:54 p.m..  Includes case 15CF380 & 15CM486.  There is an agreement.  State is requesting a COMPAS Evaluation before the Plea/Sentencing.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bail is continued. Pre-trial conference at 11-04-2015 02:30 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF: Joseph John Lagrander appeared by phone.  Court called at 1:35 p.m.  Includes case 15CF380 & 15CM486.  DE is in treatment.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.   Court adjourned at 1:37 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Status conference at 10-05-2015 01:30 pm

INCLUDES 15CF380 & 15CM486

Bond becomes effective 12::00 p.m. on 08/30/15 and DE is to be transported directly to Hazelden in Center City.

- DE to sign release of information for his treatment at Hazeldon for the DA's office and for his attorney

- DE to remain at Hazeldon until successful completion of the program and then upon discharge to report directly to the court at 1:00 p.m. on the day of release. Branch 3 does not object to any other Branch hearing the Bail Bond Hearing.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebeka S..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.


-

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Joseph John Lagrander appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:40 p.m. Includes case 15CF380 (arraignment) & 156CM486. Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts.  Attorney Andrea argues bond.  Court modifies bond.  Court adjourned.  lw  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Appointing Atty Andrea. km

INCLUDES 15CM486 & 15CF380

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebeka S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Joseph John Lagrander appeared.  Court called at 2:16 p.m.  S/T of Investigator Jim Mikla of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Nieskes.  DE is identified by Investigator Mikla. State's Ex. 1 (Photo) O/R.  Cross by Attorney Andrea.  Attorney Andrea asks for the resport written by Deputy Johnson and reviewed by Investigator Mikla before the PH be produced for his review.  ADA Nieskes produces report for Attorney Andrea to review.  Continued cross by Attorney Andrea.  Witness excused.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment.  Attorney Andrea argues bond. Court denies bond modification.  Bond is continued.  Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 08-19-2015 02:00 pm

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebeka S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
